div.p: 1. talaimakaṉ ciṟaippuṟamākat tōḻi ceṟippaṟivuṟuttatu. 2. uyir cela vēṟṟu varaivu variṉum atu māṟṟuṭaṟku nikaḻttatūumām.
1. The confidante informing of confinement, while HE is behind the hedge. 2. Undertaken, even when another marriage comes while live passes, to prevent that. (TP 109, l.14)

lg.l: This foolish village has people in distress

who do not inquire after afflicted heartsWhat is the function of the construction cāvu + -oṭu (cf. KT 145.4)? It might be understood either like above as an indirect object, or also to be connected with the mākkaḷ: "distressed people who do not inquire, with afflicted hearts: ...".:
[she with the] flower earring, what will become of her?

– round-shaped breasts, surpassing potsHow do we have to understand the construction and content of ceppuṭaṉ etiriṉa? In any case this n.pl. needs a subject, which cannot but be mulai. Cām. glosses with ceppoṭu māṟupaṭṭaṉa "at variance with pots", presumably in the sense of the Sanskrit topos of breasts competing with pots for their shape and extension.,

fullyniṟaiya: is this infinitive to be understood adverbially? swollen the pretty soft bosomWhat is the difference between mulai and ākam? Does the former refer to the actual breasts and the latter to the bosom?,

while the leaf-adorned hips, unbearablytāṅkal cellā is to be taken adverbially; cf. KT 265.1, 287.4, 340.4 for the construction of verbal noun plus cellā(tu). Moreover cel might have the function of an auxiliary: "not arrived at bearing". Srin. suggests understanding cel as "to be suitable, acceptable".,
become troublesome to the narrow small waist?
